website_summaries.verdict: The best budget bike bag that doubles as a shoulder bag to easily take with you wherever you may go.
pros: Constructed of nylon fabric and waterproof zippers to protect the items on the inside
Features a shoulder strap that tucks away while on the bike
Bag is easy to detach from the bike quickly when using as a shoulder bag
cons: Bag may be difficult to fasten to the rear rack securely without it tipping over from heavy weight

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate Product Description but Decent Small Bag
customer_reviews.text: There is NO cinch-strap as shown in several of the seller's pictures and it barely holds a bike water bottle (see my photos). Otherwise, it is a nice small bag (it just fits my folding umbrella). Included is an L-shaped (and padded) nylon piece that velcros to the inside front and inside bottom of the bag in an attempt to keep the bag upright, and not scrunched, which adds a little weight. I am able to put my Abus bike lock inside the main compartment (but not in the full length side compartment) as well as my mini bike pump (fits on an angle), bike tools, extra inner tube, gloves, and a few other small items.
customer_reviews.author: Cblanca

customer_reviews.title: It's a glorified lunch box.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over other bags because of the advertised "14x9x7" inch dimensions. What I got was 12x7x7, which is the EXTERNAL measurement I took. The interior compartment is more like 12x5x5. I needed this to carry books. Don't buy this if you need much more than beach towel and sun blocking the primary compartment, to give you an idea of the dimensions. I gave three stars because it is made of water resistant material, has reflective sides, arrived on time and like does everything else it claims, but it's not as large as it portends to be. I don't think it's a matter of intentional misleading, so much as a metric/imperial conversion matter.
customer_reviews.author: Clipped Wings

customer_reviews.title: Straps don't work for all racks
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed by the velcro straps to attach to rack. All my previous bags had 4 velcro straps on the corner. This only has two straps that must go under the rack, but on many racks, including mine, the design does not allow for putting straps under -- it hits the rack support pieces, etc. I got it on, but it feels loose, not secure. My next bag will have 4 straps on the corners, I think a much better system.
customer_reviews.author: Intheshop

customer_reviews.title: Good bag. Perfect size. Concerned about quality though.
customer_reviews.text: Good size and secures on the rack well. My only issue was the quality. Straight out of the box, there is a thumb sized opening along the seems. Since I needed a bag that day, I used it anyways and it was very convenient. It held my phone, bike jacket, lock. I have only used it only on one day of biking. My only concern is the quality and how long it will last. I got a refund from the seller and they shipped me a new one, which is great. I hope the new one lasts for a while because it is the perfect size for me.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: For $25 it doesn't get any better.
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is awesome. The nylon feels good and it is conditioned enough to sustain a light heavy rain . However If you want something big for really long trips this is not for you, it'll be better to buy something bigger. No insulation but that's OK a insulated water bottle works just fine. As advertised, the padded walls do help a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Janner j.

customer_reviews.title: Larger than most
customer_reviews.text: I like the large storage capacity. We will use this on our tandem. I do not like the hook & loop straps. The main straps require connecting/overlapping under the rack. It’s difficult to get tight enough for my comfort and stabilize the bag when loaded. The front loops are also hook & loop. They are so long that they cannot be sucured around the front rail of the rack, but require going through the seat rails or around the seat post. Hopefully I’m pleasantly surprised that it remains secure on a long ride.
customer_reviews.author: James East

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was needing. I wanted a bag to carry my camera, some lunch and a water bottle and this bag is perfect. I installed it and put my camera in it and rode around the neighborhood to see if it would stay on the rear rack and it performed perfectly. It has four velcro straps that hold it securely in place so there is no danger of the bag falling off the rack. I am totally pleased with the product and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, but the rack attachment straps are too short
customer_reviews.text: Good bag, but the rack attachment straps are too short for my rack on which the rails are 5 1/2 inches apart - which is not abnormally wide. Otherwise I would probably give it 5 stars. I will return it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H

customer_reviews.title: Shorter than expected
customer_reviews.text: I picked this one because the specs showed it to be long enough to hold my pump, which fit into my old tail bag. In fact, it is at least a couple inches shorter, so the pump sticks out the back over the zipper which cannot be closed. OK unless it rains. Aside from that it seems to be well made. Also the retaining straps are so long. I have it mounted on a normal rear rack, & the straps stick out.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Klingman

customer_reviews.title: I should've sent it back
customer_reviews.text: Someone stole my other one, so I bought this one. It's a bag, but I just don't care for the Velcro locations are put. My last bike bag had 4 strips of Velcro on each corner and started at the bottom of the bag and Velcro to the top. This bag has 2 Velcro straps on the bottom of the bag and Velcro left to right across the bag. No matter how I Velcro it on my bike or motorcycle, it has a lot of slippage. I hate giving bad review, but maybe it will help someone and or the company. I'll try to update with photos to further explain this.
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Bike bag
customer_reviews.text: The Kolo bag is exactly as described and looks great. I just received this item I'll give you my opinion without a true test. I am not a marathon biker so even though I thought this bag to be a bit on the short side it is more than adequate for two 20oz insulated water bottles , a couple of snacks, some bike tools, and some personal items for the side pockets. Looking forward to our next ride where I'm not worried about running out of water and the bag is easy to put on the bike rack so if I take valuables, the bag has a shoulder strap so I can take it with me without a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon A Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag, solid value.
customer_reviews.text: Like this bag, zippers are smooth, just right size for my rack, secures to rack well, heavy straps, although front straps are to long for my rack, an xtra wrap of strap took care of it. Holds what I thought based other reviews. Live in a fairly dry area and don’t choose to ride in rain, not a commuter, so water resistance will serve me fine. Price is probably a tad high for what it is, but it works and fits well, so what’s a couple extra bucks. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: Good bag (not as huge as picture indicated)
customer_reviews.text: The “water bottle holder” pouch at the back only works if the bag is not packed full. Once my bottle flew out. Just as advertised otherwise, except one picture of a guy using the shoulder strap to have it over his shoulder -- it is not that huge, fortunately. The dimensions are listed correctly and indeed it fits on a typical rear bike rack. There were a couple threads sticking out that I had to cut off. There are 4 straps with Velcro tabs to attach it to your rack (tricky to get it on exactly straight, but it is secure). The straps are a bit too long for my rack so I had to loop them a couple times.
customer_reviews.author: L.J. Stars

customer_reviews.title: Velcro straps are inadequate
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been struggling with this bag for 9 months. The bag itself is made well as expected. However the Velcro attachment straps are 1) to short in the case of the rear attachment (single transverse strap), and 2) needs two rear straps instead a single strap. I spend so much time trying to attach this bag, I’ve given up instead using a bungee cord to hold it in place. The double forward straps are better, but still need improvement. I suggest attachment straps should be on the sides for easy and effective mounting.
customer_reviews.author: --SJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not very universal
customer_reviews.text: Mixed opinion, the bag arrived flatten. I was able to reshape it and it looks good. As some reviewers alluded to, the bag does not securely fasten to my rear rack. The straps seem too short for my rear carrier. I will need to rig some additional fasteners, bungee cords? It does seem like it’s built well, just not very universal.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Fit my bike perfectly (after initially installing it wrong whoops). So much lighter and more convenient than metal baskets! The velcro straps are pretty adjustable and have good grip. Got caught in a downpour, and it kept EVERYTHING safe (including important paperwork). It's large enough to pick up a couple of groceries or pack a big lunch. I usually put stuff that really needs to stay cold in it, such as cream or smoked salmon. The rest I'll throw over my handlebars.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful bike bag!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is awesome.We love to ride bike and used to take backpack for longer trails.This bag is very comfortable and the velcro straps holds the bag very well.This bag has five openings and has a pouch for carrying water bottle.Made of high quality fabric and love that its waterproof.There is even shoulder strap to carry the bag any where.This bag is exactly as pictured and has high quality zippers.This bag will last for years.The double foam pad is nice to keep things stable.Great to carry snacks,food,towel etc.Overall,this bag is a good companion while on a trip.I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky10z

customer_reviews.title: A solid, budgetminded choice
customer_reviews.text: I just got this rack trunk Friday and used it twice so far (in 4 days)---once for a recreational ride and the other for commuting to school. It holds all of my bike tools +. The zippers are self repairing, thank you. I do take issue with the waterproof claim. Sometimes, your description also claims that it is water resistant, so.please decide one or the other because they are vastly different. The trunk doesn't stay put on my rack with Velcro alone so I improvised with zipties front and back to stabilize. A good value overall.
customer_reviews.author: Christine D. Bierman

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I mounted it on a RadRover electric bike ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I mounted it on a RadRover electric bike (currently down for repair). I like your bag much more than the saddle bags I ordered from RadPower. I like the the stiff form. I keep a small trauma kit and bike tools in it. Still room for small groceries. Doesn't move around or shift much even with heavier items like ammunition. Good times all around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: It seems durable and very well made. Great for the price. Big enough for my commute (10 miles). It holds tightly to my rear rack and it doesn't move side to side. The only thing I would like better is more velcro on the rear straps. Other than that I think it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Bad workmanship for a supposedly a high quality item relative to competitors
customer_reviews.text: The bottom mounting strap was not sewn all the way. One of the thread is beginning to unwind. Also one of the side pocket and back pocket does not hold shape. KOLO claims that the I looks like KOLO (the seller) simply took the bag from TopSun (which is sold on Amazon for $12.56) and simply added the bottom stiffening pad and charge you 2X the price ($25.49). Stay away from this merchant.
customer_reviews.author: RH-Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Spend a few dollars more to get a decent bag.
customer_reviews.text: This came missing parts. The velcro straps were so excessively long that I had to rig them to try to get it to stay on my bike. Even then, I couldn't get it tight. The water bottle holder is a joke. The only thing I could get to fit in it was a bottle of insect repellent that's about an inch and a half across. It's going back. Hopefully Amazon will refund my money and make it right. Update: I returned the item today and my money has already been refunded by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nowadays, I find "as advertised" to be a helpful indicator
customer_reviews.text: It is just the right size to carry the necessities. Today it held a spare tube and the items/tools that go with that, an ice pack, (3) 16 oz bottles of water, keys, wallet, phone, caramel rice cakes (small pack), tissue travel pack and still had a bit of space left with nothing being crushed together. It holds onto the bike well and its structural form stays as you see it, which is much better than the old one that it replaced whose weight would shift. For me its perfect small bag for my after work trail runs.
customer_reviews.author: Wulfe

customer_reviews.title: Shutterbug Companion
customer_reviews.text: Kolo Sports Pannier is excellent! The main compartment secures my camera equipment which includes DSLR, 55mm and telephoto lens with room to spare. Although it is nicely padded, I line the bottom of the bag with bubblewrap when I occasionally travel off-road. The large side pocket is ideal for bungie straps which I use to secure a monopod to the top of the bag (see photo) or use for large packages. A smaller side pocket nicely accommodates my iPhone. The Velcro straps tightly secures the pannier to the bike rack preventing back and forth or sideway movement. Kolo Sports manufactures a quality bag at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Quilp

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller than image shows
customer_reviews.text: I am a little shocked, it appears to be much larger in the image than it is. Two side pockets are to small for a cell phone, other side pocket is long so it will fit but not much room for anything else. Top main pocket, can fit light weight jacket OR a small and I mean small cooler with a sandwich or two and drink. The free return says UNUSED, just how is one to know if it is going to work if they cannot try it out? DUH Might not keep, need top rack bag larger than this so will try it out first.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Good functional bag, quality construction and materials.
customer_reviews.text: Likes: It looks decent. It's functional. There are a lot of separate pockets and ample space. It fits my rack well. The straps on the bottom secure the bag to my rack and are strong and easy to use. The materials seem well made. Dislikes: Price is a bit steep, but I think it's worth it. I wish there were some kind of quick connect options for the rack and bag straps. In other words, a way I could attach connectors that click onto the bag for quick connect/disconnect. Otherwise, well engineered.
customer_reviews.author: Devine

customer_reviews.title: Small and poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: This bag is small. If you need much more room than the cycling basics, tube, tool pouch, etc purchase something else. The pockets are very small and a cell phone will fit only in the largest of the three pockets. The water bottle holder is useless. Even a throwaway plastic water bottle does not fit. This is not what most cyclists would call a standard trunk bag. The straps that attach the bag to the rack are poorly designed and clumsy to use.
customer_reviews.author: spokes

customer_reviews.title: Very functional medium-sized rack bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice rack bag. I found no problem fitting it on a Blackburn rack with the provided straps. Holds its shape well. Capacity is nice to stuff in a few tools, my lock, a windbreaker, lunch, etc.. Probably a bit small for a commuter bag unless you are just packing a compact change of clothes, but it looks like it would be easy to bungie a pair of shoes on top. My only complaint is that the water bottle holder on the back is a bit small. Looks like it fits a regular bike bottle, but it is just a little small for a 1L Nalgene or Hydroflask. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice side pockets for all the necessary tools and accessories
customer_reviews.text: What a great bag. Bought on for my husband last August.( Bought myself a "fancier" one that didn't stay on the rack and had to be returned.) This bag has the straps in the right place for our racks and is very secure. It has some nice side pockets for all the necessary tools and accessories. The center pocket holds the extra sweater and snacks we need with no problem. Water bottle pocket is short, but holds the extra bottle without it sweating all over the clothes in the main pocket. I highly recommend this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Tnpmommy

customer_reviews.title: Velcro too Short
customer_reviews.text: Bought to install on a standard bike rack 5.5 inches wide. Should have worked with no problems only the velcro was too short or sewn on the wrong location. The Velcro was located on the excess portion of the strap and would not fasten. This bag looked like I would have gotten a lot of use out of it if would it have had more velcro. Returned unit.
customer_reviews.author: Sheree Rae Gaunt

customer_reviews.title: Pictures not 100% accurate
customer_reviews.text: Some of the pictures show a cord on the pouch holding a water bottle. My bag does not have this cord. It only has a very weak elastic band on the top that neither stretches very much nor squeezes very tight. After hitting a few bumps, my bottle went flying out. This pouch is not useful for bottles, it only works for smaller things that fit completely inside the pouch. 3 stars instead of 4 because I was deceived. Had I known it had no cord I would have gotten a different bag. Except for that, the bag works well. Zippers are smooth and the straps hold the bag securely on the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Damir

customer_reviews.title: Small, well made bag.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, well made bag for the price. Actually smaller than the pictures make it look. It's for my wife's fold-able ebike. She didn't need a really large bag, just some thing for tools,air pump, tube ,water bottle. Not big enough for a picnic lunch or shopping in town. If you need that get one that has 2 bags that hang off the sides. Only one bottom strap worked on the rear carrier so I used 2 wire ties to secure it and it looks like it will work fine, just not removable unless I cut the tie wire ties, not sure if that might be a issue for her.
customer_reviews.author: Eric A Moberg Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit all racks, wobbly and rattling, and too small.
customer_reviews.text: First, this bag does not fit all racks. I have a standard rack and it takes about ten minutes to attach it to or remove it from the rack. When attached, it's loose, wobbly, and rattling on the rack. Second, it is way smaller than depicted in the product photos. Probably half the size of what you imagine. The person carrying it in the product photos is probably a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Amir

customer_reviews.title: Strapping it on your bike is difficult.
customer_reviews.text: The velcro connection is on the bottom of the bag. I have two bikes with only about 3/4 inch between the luggage rack and the fender of my bikes. I cannot easily attach the velcro and once attached it is almost impossible to detach the velcro since I can't get my fingers or hands under the luggage rack. I bought a different brand where the velcro is on the side which makes attaching and detaching the bag so much simpler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bargain bag
customer_reviews.text: I have an older bike that is now more of a cruiser. I wanted a rear bag to hold stuff for day trips. The bag is larger than I was expecting, which is not a bad thing. I can comfortably fit a rain poncho, snacks and lunch. the side pockets are great for car keys, wallet and Colorado supplies. The bag it made with thick material and is stiff enough to hold it's shape. For what it costs, I couldn't be happier with it. It is exactly what I needed. Great bargain.
customer_reviews.author: B R J

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, it's working well for me
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to get the optimal fit on my bike rack oh, and this would be the case with any bag like this that sets on top of my bike rack. Overall I'm very satisfied with the product and recommend it. One suggestion I would make is to include an interior piece that I can move around to subdivide the interior of the bag oh, I would use this to put sharp things like keys or a pocket knife or tools and have another area where I could put devices that might be scratched like my phone for a pair of glasses. Construction and quality are good
customer_reviews.author: Picky Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good little cargo bag
customer_reviews.text: This works great on my rear bike rack, although I had to experiment with different ways of fastening it on until I found one that works to keep it from shifting about. A standard bicycle water bottle fits in the pocket on the back. There's enough room for lunch and a few other items in the larger compartment. The side pockets are good for other things like papers, wallet, keys, phone, etc. I've had it a couple months and used it often. It's holding up well, seems sturdy, and zippers still work!
customer_reviews.author: GBaybee

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice, sturdy bag which keeps items hidden away and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice, sturdy bag which keeps items hidden away and secure while riding. I gave only four stars because I can't attach it easily, only because my bike rack has horizontal slats. Seems to be made for bike racks with vertical slats. So either I will connect it across the rack with the bag hanging over each side, or I'll have to find a way to add to and extend the velcro.😕 But other than that, its pretty awesome.
customer_reviews.author: cathybee

customer_reviews.title: Good but not secure
customer_reviews.text: Good size bag but it was very hard to get it tight against my bike rack had to use a bungee cord to make sure it didn't go anywhere but it may work better on different racks, if you plan on using this with an ebike to hold the battery I'd recommend using btrpower's 48v 18ah battery it fits in the main compartment perfectly and still has about 2inches above it
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great way to travel
customer_reviews.text: If you like long bike rides, this is the way to go. Now I don't have to worry about tying things up with bungee cords or fretting about lack of pockets for keys, phone, etc. Everything fits nicely. The velcro straps are generic size, so I found it took some ingenuity to make it fit my rack. But once it was strapped on, everything was secure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fastens very securely, not large enough to hold a helmet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rear carrier bag. Some people like lots of pockets, some do not; I do. Seems very well made, attaches very securely, comes with a shoulder strap that I will probably never use. One possible detraction: it is not big enough to hold a helmet, but it’s a small trade-off for the compact size. If you plan to do all your grocery shopping by bicycle you probably want a full pannier set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recomended
customer_reviews.text: Good materials and construction. Stays on the rack securely. Velcro is heavy duty, should last. I use it as a gym bag and bike to the gym. Holds enough but I think it could be a inch or a inch and a half higher to hold more. It holds a 11 inch kindle, noises canceling headphones, change of underwear, socks, t shirts, extra water bottle. No room for shoes but I don't need that. Side pockets hold wallet, keys, phone, shaving kit etc. As you can see you can get quite a bit into this small bag. Good product...recommended purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price and function can go hand in hand
customer_reviews.text: After looking at no less than 50 rack bags I decided to go for this. It is simply a good product, the price is a total bonus. It holds everything I need, even a charger. (eBike). It is stable, stays shaped and can be carried over the shoulder with extra strap. It does not come with a rain cover but a small plastic trash bag works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kman1

customer_reviews.title: Enough room for everything I need.
customer_reviews.text: Love the bag!!! Enough compartments for small stuff, big area for lock, dog leash, gloves and jacket. Which was my main concern! The side pocket, is big too. And at the same time is small enough for the rack. The safety Velcros are big and it has 3 of them to secure the bag from moving. Yes there is room for a small light clip and for another water bottle or anything else for that matter. Great price. Very satisfied. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Bag as described and arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be well made and good quality at a good price! Have not had the bag long enough to really test durability but do not see any design flaws with initial observations. Zippers look strong, attachments are strong enough if the durability holds up. Of the several bags I checked out think this was the best of the bunch for the right price. It might be a tad small for a regular commuter, but this is intended for the back of a mountain bike for off road use, so just the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Great bike bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for my husbands bike and he loves it. The first day he used it, it was raining and it kept all his things dry inside. The size is perfect, easily fits his lunch, and work shirt and few other random things he takes with him. Great quality material, overall very well made.
customer_reviews.author: SylviaO

customer_reviews.title: Good bag/Bad Straps
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is great. It has a ton of room, water resistant and different compartments for different sized items. However, the Velcro straps are not universal and seem to be geared towards a particular type of bike rack. I had to rig my bag onto my rack. It works but it won’t be easy coming off. Different straps would make this bad a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon S.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific trunk bag for carrying bike battery
customer_reviews.text: This bag is sturdy, fits securely on a bike rack, and is perfect for holding my son's bike battery. He rides to and from school every day (almost 10 miles r/t). We were securing the battery to the rack with bungee cords; this works much better and more securely. The rain cover keeps the battery and cord dry. Would absolutely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lv2Read

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Surprizingly high quality materials and construction. No issues what-so-ever with the stitching, zippers, velcro, etc. Had to attach to my rack a little differently than my old bag. People with wide racks may have trouble attaching this bag. A little smaller than the bag it replaced. I took an empty laundry soap container cut to the appropriate height to use as an inner liner for the main compartment and it fit perfectly. (This is for the purpose of being able to ice down some beverages purchased on route for later enjoyment.)
customer_reviews.author: jeff starr

customer_reviews.title: Great bag. You need this!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both bought one of these bags in the same month. I ordered first & once I used it the he needed to get one! While I was riding it hot warm & I folded up my jacket & it fit inside the bag, along with my portable pump & other things. I saw a similar bag at my local bike shop for $129.99. Buy this bag, you wont be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: jane briggs

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT WORK BAG
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect size for me riding my bike to work. The quality is top notch including the zipper, velcro, etc., considering the price is in the low end. Seldom can you see a product now that the price is cheap and the quality is great. There is enough pouch that you could separate the things you want in the saddle bag. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: OQI

customer_reviews.title: Great bag and great features.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag! Unfortunately, I had to return it because it wasn’t quite long enough to fit my extra long u-lock. The bag has great pockets, reflective strips and to me the best part was it held it’s shape. I have ordered two other bags since returning this one and they both arrived smashed flat. I unflattened them but they still look deformed. I stuffed the bags with towels to get it to reshape but after the towels come out they still look uneven. Check your size needs (which I didn’t do) and if this works for you don’t hesitate. Great bag!
customer_reviews.author: CMM

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Velcro straps way to long to fit Electra Townie rear rack. The only way I can think of to make it fit would be to cut 4 inch out of strap and sew it back together. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: magnacharger

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: seems rare to receive the quality you expect , this bag is quality. nice zippers ,nice shape good thicknes to the fabric. In short awesome bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tory Mihalik

customer_reviews.title: No sag
customer_reviews.text: This bag straps on my built to the frame rack unlike the last one, but not as well if the straps were a little longer. I’m sure it would work better on a aftermarket rack which usually are narrower. It’s only been two weeks, but it’s still holding it’s form and not sagging like the last bag I had. The side zip pouches are a nice feature and room in the main compartment to hold a couple freezer packs , water and Gatorade.
customer_reviews.author: G Keller

customer_reviews.title: BIKE BAG.......not just for bycycles
customer_reviews.text: GREAT item. Very well made. Four nice compartments with extra pouch for drink bottle or cup. Will strap to about anything or any bike rack. Reflective tape all around is a nice safety plus. I really use it strapped to the rear rack of my YAMAHA XT 250 motorcycle to keep my water bottle,phone, DMV papers, gloves, sun screen, first aid kit ,snack, sun glasses, and a light jacket. I've used it for weeks and it is tuff and still looks like new. Zippers are strong too. Keeps its shape nice and looks great. I'm going to buy another one just for a back up later if I ever wear this one out. By the way...................GREAT PRICE too.
customer_reviews.author: Candia C. Cobble

customer_reviews.title: Low price- good quality, but not as high as the Bushwacker
customer_reviews.text: I bought two, this one is nice and definetly worth it, but not tall as the other but since I have both I may switch off as the Bushwacker makes it hard to get on/off the bike it towers over bike seat. BUT, I would be giving up plenty of cargo space with this smaller one. It goes on the back of the bike, so not sure why they ask if its easy to drink from !
customer_reviews.author: Truth and nothing but ...

customer_reviews.title: It is very nice except that the top zipper is a bit flimsy ...
customer_reviews.text: It is very nice except that the top zipper is a bit flimsy and only has one pull tab. It would be much more convenient if it had 2 pull tabs like most bags and cases. That way you don't have to pull the tab all the way around to close the zipper - you get a better angle on the zipper that way and are less likely to break it.
customer_reviews.author: Christine H.

customer_reviews.title: Works great with one caveat
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice quality bike bag, The only issue is the Velcro strips used to attach it to the bike carrier rack are too short, and does not provide a secure attachment to the bike rack. I needed to rap them around the carrier frame several times in order for the Velcro strips to align and attach to each other securely .
customer_reviews.author: maurice stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Just a fantastic bike bag. The small side pockets are perfect for mall items such as keys and a wallet. The larger side pocket I perfect for a phone. The main compartment will hold a light jacket, lock, or a snack. The bottle holder on the rear is very handy also. The attachment straps are a bit ackward because they are underneath the bag. If a bike has fenders, as mine does, it is a rather tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: Wiley Beal

customer_reviews.title: The perfect commuter bicycle accessary.
customer_reviews.text: The bag is absolutely perfect for my needs. There's plenty of room in the main compartment for my DSLR camera and flash. The bag is nicely padded and is weather resistant. Not only is it a nifty camera bag, but it's proving to be handy for all source of tasks, like carrying my lunch, use as a fishing tackle bag, or whatever. I don't think I'll ever take it off of my bike's rack. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Donnie G

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bag
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this bag for a couple weeks now and I’m happy with my purchase so far. The Velcro attachments hold well. Side compartments are good size. Only complaint I have is the rear water bottle holder did not come with the drawstring as pictured. For me not a big deal as my water bottle is larger in size that this will accommodate. it’s a good bag at a good price you won’t be disappointed if you decide purchase one as well.
customer_reviews.author: JRock

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, mine has one minor mistake
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it will work well. Holds a water bottle fairly tight too. Just what I wanted when I ordered it. However, one of the straps that attaches around the seat post had the Velcro part sewn on upside down, so the part that is supposed to stick won't because its sewn to the strap. Otherwise, I would recommend it. Price is pretty good too.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Bertoli

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact carrier
customer_reviews.text: Well made material, straps, and zippers A bit smaller then I expected, but suits my needs. The large storage compartment will only hold a sweatshirt and an extra water bottle, or maybe a a tee shirt and a pair of women's running shoe, too small for my mens size 10.
customer_reviews.author: Alan T

customer_reviews.title: It's quite slim
customer_reviews.text: It looks good, just seemed wider in the pictures, its actually just as narrow as the back rack so if your planning to carry much of anything in this you may want to consider the panniers with trunk bag combo. Also, the back elastic bottle holder is very tight, you will need a very slender bottle to fit it.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy apple

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting bike bag for an elecric bike.
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be made well. I had to take the liner out to fit a light jacket and a container with 2 sandwiches in it, but it was doable. I wish it was a little bigger, but it does fit nicely on the back of my electric Rad City. Straps are long enough and it is very secure.
customer_reviews.author: S. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: 100% worth your cash
customer_reviews.text: The is really good quality considering the price u are paying. I had alot of extra velcro once tightly secured on my bike rack . Even tho due to my bike rack I had to figure out a way for the vertical straps it still worked out fine and yes the water bottle holder fits a 20oz ish water bottle No i havent gotten to test the water proof part yet but im sure it will be fine 😅
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly and serves my needs...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect and spacious enough for commuting and leisure biking trips. I love the separate compartments on the sides and strong straps on the bottom to secure to my rack. I will definitely recommend to my family, friend’s and colleagues.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Gordon

customer_reviews.title: I love it! At first when I opened I was ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it! At first when I opened I was disappointed. But then I started forming the bag, I'd perfect size, I am a photographer and it being waterproof is great!!! The main compartment fits my D500 and 3 lenses perfect. Then you have your other compartments to put in accessories! It has a flat bottom so it fits perfect on the back of my bike . For what I use it for its 5 starts for me
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hostetler

customer_reviews.title: As advertised but not impressive.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is as advertised. It is a direct copy of the bag from Roswheel which it replaces though the compartments are just slightly smaller (enough that the cell phone pocket can't be zipped with the phone in when the old one could). Hopefully it is better constructed since the reason for replacing the old bag was that it was falling apart due to poor stitching. The difference in pocket size seems to be due to differences in the stitching location.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy...
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice, made well, straps are velcro though so they may loose their effectiveness after a yr of steady use. But it fit very secure on back of my bike easy. Just every time i go into a store I gota un-velcro it than refasten it to my bike- afraid some1 would steal it if I left it on. The main comparment easy holds a few basic things but not much.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Plisa

customer_reviews.title: Feels sturdy and looks great
customer_reviews.text: Quickly to install. It fits my camera and lenses I bring on rides (in addition to other stuff). Feels sturdy and looks great. -- Update -- I recently bought an e-bike (with a rear-rack mounted battery). Due to the battery, the bag sits a little higher than my seat, but it still fits perfectly. It's also easier to attach with the velcro straps to this particular rack.
customer_reviews.author: M. Scheffers

customer_reviews.title: Cool bag if you can be gentle with your things~ Smells on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very quickly and well packaged. Looking forward to the intensely off-putting and beyond pungent stench that is permeating from this bag. Once it, (wears off?), likely after a few good long rides, should be fantastic! Simply something to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Tschogl

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. The material and workmanship seems to be of ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The material and workmanship seems to be of higher quality.The bag itself is slightly smaller then I'm used to. But overall I am pleased with the purchase. Update : one of the bottom velcro straps has completely broke off. I will be sending back. It's unfortunate. I had high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Glover

customer_reviews.title: Very good value - good size and comes with water bottle holder which is very handy
customer_reviews.text: I like the zippered pockets that allow me to separate items to be able to find them and the fact that the center part is large enough to hold the larger items... pump, nylon back pack and flannel shirt. The velcro straps are sturdy and work great to attach it to my carrier. Over all am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: YaYouBetcha

customer_reviews.title: I like this bag
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag. It is well made. I would call it lightly insulated due to it haveing a double wall construction. There is enough room for a six pack, snack, and plenty of side pocket room for tools, wallet, phone, cables, bike lock, water bottle.... The straps included to strap it down are solid. I'm glad to have made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Donald W. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Well made, great price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these for my husband's new bike and liked it so much I ordered one for myself too. The bag looks sharp on the back our bike, stays in place and is well made. They have 3 outside zippered pockets which are great for organizing things and plenty of room inside for a wind breaker, snacks, lunch, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi-Q

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I always find the bottom straps a little lacking on bags and these are pretty much ok. It was a little wobbly on my very basic rack and I used the small handlebar straps to secure it to the seat post end of my rack and it's secure now and won't budge. Nice bag. As with any bag the water bottle will fall out of the back if you hit a big bump. I recommend this bag, seems good, keeps it's shape and looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: ... it yet due to one of the straps is bad upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet due to one of the straps is bad upon arrival. Trying to figure how to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: jimt

customer_reviews.title: MISSING BONUS INSERT FOR ADDITIONAL SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to contact you regarding the bike bag. We have ordered three of them and the listing states that there is a BONUS PADDED INSERT to create extra structural support. We have already received two of them and neither of the bags included the BONUS padded insert. The third bag is delayed so I don't know if the insert will be included. We would like to have this insert to add additional support. How can we receive this??? Jane Snider (909) 936-2014
customer_reviews.author: jane l snider

customer_reviews.title: No bottle
customer_reviews.text: Generally is looks like a nice bag. However, the photos used for the advertisement are deceptive. There is no way any reasonable water bottle will fit in the bottle holder. Opening much to small and height much to short. I could barely fit a little plastic water bottle in it. So I've returned the bag and will have to start looking in stores where I can actually handle the bag and make sure a my bottle fits.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for bike rack. Adequate storage
customer_reviews.text: Feels durable and the zippers are tight and function with ease. I like the various pockets and the sizes are good for a small first aid kit, small water bottle, bicycling tools, trail map, etc. Pick and pack what you need for the occasion. Velcro straps fit perfectly on my rack.
customer_reviews.author: Hos

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the size
customer_reviews.text: This bag is NOT 14". It's 10". And that was a real deal breaker for me. Also, the outside pockets seemed rather on the small size as well. It might be a nice, sturdy well made bag, but it was way too small for my purposes. The description should have been more clear/accurate. It's going back tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Smilin Sam

customer_reviews.title: the width of the bike rack
customer_reviews.text: the entire side stitching came loose and only used 5 times and only 1/2 filled. Tried to reply to your message reply but could not send picture. I will update this review after a successful resolution. It is a great item except for the stitching.
customer_reviews.author: trail rider

customer_reviews.title: Well built bike bag.
customer_reviews.text: I like the bike bag very much. It is very sturdy and holds everything I need to take along on a ride. The bag is less than half the price of a comparable one from my local bike shop. There is a lot of morning dew where I am at and the bag gets wet on the outside, but no water penetrates to the interior.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

customer_reviews.title: 2 bags, different strap lengths.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these bags. They are identical except the straps on one are much shorter than the other. The funny thing is neither of them are a good length for attaching to our racks (Ibera PakRak). One is too short to go around the entire rack and the other is so long it's hard to get a lot of the Velcro to line up. The bag itself is very useful and holds a lot of stuff and has many different pockets to keep you organised.
customer_reviews.author: Northern

customer_reviews.title: Great bag. Pictures may be a little misleading on how big of a water bottle can fit in the rear pouch.
customer_reviews.text: My only issue is that the pictures imply I should be able to fit a water bottle in that rear pouch, but in reality it's very tight and shallow and my water bottle didn't fit. Even if I could force it in there, I wouldn't trust it to hold on a bumpy ride because of how shallow it is. Maybe it could fit one of those 12 oz Coke bottles, that might be short and skinny enough. Anyways, in all other aspects it's a great bag. It has an adequate variety of compartment sizes, the straps are very secure, and I appreciate that it came with a shoulder strap.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Good Bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is well made and looks good but a bit smaller than I had expected. That said I was able to pack 2 drinks and 2 submarine sandwiches and a blue ice block into it on our most recent bike ride. It attaches solidly to the carrier shelf on the back of my bike and nothing shifted on about a 20 mile ride. I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joel C

customer_reviews.title: Attaches nicely to the bike and will stay there without any ...
customer_reviews.text: Attaches nicely to the bike and will stay there without any fear of it falling off. I LOVE the reflective strips. I have a feeling they may fall off sooner than I'd like, but I'll update my review if that happens. I threw it out in the rain for a little bit to test how well it stayed dry. It'd did a pretty good job in the end. I'm liking it so far!
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mountain bike. When I go camping I ride the forest roads to get to hiking/fishing spots. I needed extra storage on my bike but not a huge amount. This bag was just the right size for me and it seems to be made well. Worth the money, which wasn't a whole lot.
customer_reviews.author: amazon man

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made, just big enough, tricky to strap on
customer_reviews.text: Overall this bag is: Sturdy, well made, just big enough, but tricky to strap on. The designers did thier best to give the bag flexibility when used on a vatiety of bike raks. Commendable, but try strapping it on and loading it before using it for the first time. This is quite studry and the pocets are great. Four sizes and shapes allow for a variety of storage. Love the additional saftey of thevreflective strips. Well done Kolo!
customer_reviews.author: Kellie R.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a Magnum Metro Ui6 that has a wide 5 1/2” wide rack. There was plenty of Velcro to wrap around the rack holding the bag firmly in place. I take only day trips or less and the capacity is more than sufficient to meet my needs. I can affirm all the positive reviews on the site and have trouble with the negative reviews. A quality product at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: Handy, Durable, Sturdy, and Extremely Useful!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is amazingly sturdy and durable and truly protected my things from the rain on my bike ride today! Got stuck in surprise showers and came out with everything intact! Even has a strap for your shoulder so you can easily carry it once you get off the bike too! I love that it has multiple pockets so I can organize my stuff and that it helped me to carry what I needed with me on my bike without having to wear a backpack or any other gear!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Foutch

customer_reviews.title: Need adjustable buckle .. Velcro toooo long
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made but amazingly they didn’t pay attention the Velcro is so long , so it can’t be tightens On narrow holder They needed adjustment type ..buckle So sadly returning
customer_reviews.author: atoosa kashani

customer_reviews.title: Super nice bike bag.
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery and the bag really look great. It fits perfectly on the back of my e-bike, i like the way they put some extra side pocket on the side because it it really useful. I love it and I will recommend to all my friend.
customer_reviews.author: SeeMeHere

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bag, Poor straps
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bag to commute since May of 2018. I fill the main compartment and overall it regularly is at about 90% total capacity. Never have had if leak in the rain, zippers intact (minus half a pull tab), and I find it holds its shape well. The straps were easy to make secure, Velcro has held up (if not heavily tested—I tend to leave it on the rack), but have not held up. The stitching on the main straps started giving way about 2 months ago and are now totally gone. Still, pretty good for a $22 bag.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bush

customer_reviews.title: Straps too long
customer_reviews.text: Do not like the Velcro fasteners. Too long. I use bunny cords to hold it to my rack
customer_reviews.author: NQR4

customer_reviews.title: Well made and nicely sized.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size (12"long, 6"high, 8" wide), I like the ability of the bag to hold it's shape when empty or full, and the hold down straps work well, are well thought out, and are quick to tie down to my rack. The carry strap is a bonus. It is well made and the outside pockets are good for stuff you use often.
customer_reviews.author: John Havens Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality construction, mounts easy, well thought out. Reflective stripes a bonus, water bottle holder is a real plus not found on other bags of this quality. Could be a little bigger, but that is not an issue for me. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Great for commuters
customer_reviews.text: Really sturdy and helps me with commuting. I ride with a lot of gear and this helps me keep everything organized without having to wear a backpack. Haven't used it in the rain yet, but looks like the material will last. Definitely recommend for the price. I do wish however that there was some way to secure your bag if you don't feel like bringing it with you inside some place.
customer_reviews.author: Talen

product_meta.title: Kolo Sports Bike Pannier Bag | Durable & Waterproof Nylon with Extra Padded Foam Bottom & 3 Side Reflectors | Shoulder Strap Rack Rear Trunk Tote Bag | Strong Velcro, Zipper Pockets & Bottle Case
feature_bullets: MULTI FUNCTIONAL BICYCLE GEAR BAG: If you are looking for the most multi-functional and easy to carry around travel bag, then we got you covered. This bicycle saddle bag is designed to satisfy even the most demanding biking needs to the fullest and will certainly become your favorite on the road companion no matter where you are going either by bike or on foot!

DURABLE NYLON & WATERPROOF CONSTRUCTION BIKE BAG: Kolo Sports has meticulously designed this portable bike bag from high quality Nylon fabric. Forget all those poorly made Polyester bags and trust our durable and water resistant bike trunk organizer. The bottom bears double cushioning padded foam so as to enhance the support and keep your belongings absolutely safe!

ERGONOMIC DESIGN BICYCLE STORAGE BAG: Our pannier bag is made in such a way so as to be extremely ergonomic and comfortable to use. It is equipped with 2 zippered pockets to keep your most valuable stuff inside like iPhones, cameras or cash and credit cards. The strong Velcro will keep the bag where it belongs and the spacious interior compartment will hold anything that comes in mind. The side water bottle case has an elastic drawstring that will secure your bottles in place.

BICYCLE REAR RACK BAG FOR VERSATILE USAGE: This bag can be used not only when you are riding your bicycle but while walking, shopping or picnicking with your friends. Besides the durable Velcro straps that will securely attach it behind the saddle, this bicycle gear bag can be used as a tote bag from the top handlebar or as a messenger bag via its shoulder strap! It’s simply all up to you!

UNISEX BAG FOR VERSATILE USES IN A SLEEVE GIFT PACKAGE: Try today our unisex rear rack black bag which is suitable for both men and women and even children and make a thoughtful present to a friend. Take it along at beach excursions, hiking with friends, camping in the woods, picnicking in the park, field trips and to many other occasions. It comes in a nice sleeve packaging and is a wonderful gift idea for a dear friend or a beloved family member.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
